title: Wisconsin mother shot, killed in front of her son as she taught him to drive, reports say
text:
A Wisconsin mother, was fatally shot in a road-rage incident on Friday while she was teaching her teenage son how to drive, reports said.

Tracey Smith, a Wisconsin Department of Corrections sergeant, was teaching her 17-year-old son how to drive in Milwaukee around 5:15 p.m. Friday when they got into a minor crash, Fox 6 reported.

Milwaukee Police wrote in a tweet, “The passenger of the vehicle that was hit got out and confronted the driver of the striking vehicle.”

CITY OF MILWAUKEE SAYS STOP VAPING 'IMMEDIATELY' AFTER 16 CASES OF 'SEVERE CHEMICAL PNEUMONIA'

Police said the man, who has not yet been named, then opened fire, killing Smith in front of her son.

“The guy zig-zagged in the street, and he also hit her,” JoAnne Luckett, Smith’s mother, told Fox 6. “She went out to look to see what was going on.”

The suspect fled from the scene but police arrested him Monday, WTMJ reported. Her 17-year-old son drove her to the hospital where she later died.

“She went to work every day,” Luckett said. “She made a life for her and her sons. I wake up every morning and it’s like, ‘Wow. Tracey is not here.’ I hate it.”

Funeral arrangements have not yet been finalized.
description: A Wisconsin mother, who was teaching her teenage son how to drive on Friday, was reportedly shot and killed in front of him during an alleged road rage incident.
authors: Talia Kaplan Is A Reporter For Foxnews.Com. Follow Her On Twitter
